column4: how do i remove a specific version of a package installed? i have 2 kernels installed and I wish to remove the older one.
so apt-get would automagically remove the older one?
alright, thanks once again! I'm pretty scared when i'm removing KERNEL packages. :)
i did this:   apt-get remove --purge linux-386
why do you want to remove the old one, BTW?
so i should apt-get the linux-386 back?
im already booted into 2.6.15.22  and i do not wish to keep 2.6.15.20
i doubt P3 is based on the i686 arch
yes i'd love to use linux-686. so should i remove linux-386 and then install linux-686, OR is there a shorter way?
what's the problem with having all of them installed? I'm curious...
